title: Toledo man arrested in shooting of 3-year-old daughter
content:
A 3-year-old girl who was shot inside a Prouty Avenue home Saturday was in serious condition today at Mercy St. Vincent Medical Center, while her father was in the Lucas County jail.
Michael C. Reyes, 27, of 749 Parker Ave. was arrested at 7:30 p.m. on charges of negligent assault and having weapons while under disability, jail records show.
Reyes, who has a prior felony conviction that means he is banned from possessing a firearm, is scheduled to be arraigned on the new charges at 9 a.m. Monday in Toledo Municipal Court.
Toledo Police remained silent about the incident, but court records indicate that Reyes told officers “he had a handgun in his possession when it discharged and struck his 3-year-old daughter” inside 533 Prouty Ave. Toledo police were called to the location about 1:45 p.m. Saturday on a report of a person shot.
A hospital spokesman said Kaylee Reyes was in serious condition in the pediatric intensive care unit.
